intro.title: Why Donate Blood and <highlight>Its Importance</highlight>
intro.description: Blood donation is not just a humanitarian act; it is a life-saving measure. One bag of your blood can save the life of an accident victim, a thalassemia patient, or a mother facing complications during childbirth.

health.title: Health Benefits
health.desc: Regular blood donation maintains iron balance in the body. It helps reduce the risk of heart disease and cancer.

cells.title: New Blood Cells
cells.desc: After donating blood, the body produces new blood cells, which increases immunity and vitality.

mind.title: Mental Satisfaction
mind.desc: The spiritual peace of saving a dying person's life cannot be found through any other work.

list.age: Age must be between 18 and 60 years.
list.weight: Weight must be at least 50 kg or more.
list.interval: At least 4 months must have passed since the last donation.

advice.title: What to Do Before & After Donation
advice.desc: It is important to eat nutritious food and drink enough water before donating blood. Rest for at least 10-15 minutes after donation and avoid heavy work for the next few hours. Your slight awareness will make the donation process easy and safe.
